Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: SuzMcL
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the cleanest hotel rooms I have stayed in in a long time. Yes, my room was not huge but i had a double bed, space to hang some clothes and a kettle and hair dryer, what more do you need :) I was on the top floor but did not mind the stairs. For the price paid this is a great little hotel and I will definitely use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Jim P
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to have to write a bad review for this hotel. We booked a room last July, 2011 for a stay in Sep. Our plans changed and I cancelled the reservation more than 4 weeks before the trip. They charged us the USD176 deposit anyway. I emailed them multiple times and even called several times and was promised that it would be corrected, but nothing was done. Finally, I disputed the charge through MasterCard. Several months later it was corrected (I thought). Then they charged me again! Only after another dispute was it corrected. They would not quit however and charged me a third time!! I am going through the dispute process for what I hope will be the final time. I am fed up with what I hope is their sheer incompetence rather than dishonesty. Needless to say I will never stay there and recommend that anyone considering booking with them take my terrible experience into account.

Reviews.Title: “Great value family room”
Reviews.Author: FamilyofFoodies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the family room (No.1) with our three children for a night and were delighted. The room contained a double and 3 proper single beds. It was attractively furnished and clean with plenty of room for us all and comfortable beds. The shower room was located down the corridor but there was a basin in the room and this didn't inconvenience us at all (good shower!). Good choice of cereals, bread, crumpets, etc etc for breakfast. All the staff were very professional and friendly. Great, peaceful location and lots of good restaurants on the doorstep (we like both Mekong & Grumbles in Churton Street). Would definitely go again - ideal base for enjoying London with good transport links.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Maxtr R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed, being within walking distance of both the Underground at Pimlico and Victoria station. The rooms are basic with some en-suite but all are clean and comfortable. Breakfast is continental, with cereals, toasts, fruit juices, cold meats and cheeses among the choices. While the on-line booking system is fine I preferred to book by telephone. This hotel was recommended to me and lived up to my expectations. When staying in London I try to make a booking here first.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF THE BLADES HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Buddy85
Reviews.Content: I just returned from London with my wife, daughter and son-in-law. Based on the recommendation in Rick Steve's book I reserved two rooms at the Blades over four months before and had received written confirmation from the hotel - "We are pleased to confirm your reservation for two double rooms." When we showed up in the late afternoon with the written confirmation in hand we were told they had no record of our reservation and basically we were SOL. We were left wandering the street with our suitcases looking for a place to stay. Fortunately, we were able to secure accommodations just down the street at the Luna Simone. It was a much cleaner hotel with a very friendly staff. It is obvious from my review and the review of July 17, 2011 that this problem is not unique and Blades has has really gone down hill.

Reviews.Title: “very good find , value for money”
Reviews.Author: florentiasouthafrica
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on the internet. We could contact them directly for a booking that immediately guaranteed no extra commissions paid to 3rd parties. Donâ€™t be fooled any site that do not give direct contact details DO TAKE commission and work up prices. The lady on the phone was very helpful in answering all our questions. Tripadvisor review was good . For the price we paid the room was much more than we expected. spacious, quiet, and a lot of extras like coffee and tea facilities in the room. A dressing table with big mirror. Clean and attractive. You got what you paid for and more. What a fantastic location. On the 24 bus line taking you right onto most tourist attractions very close to the hotel. Also very close to the Pimlico underground. A lovely small quiet underground station , one stop from Victoria station with connections in all directions, without the trouble to get in and out of a big station. At Victoria is two theatres and many restaurants. Going home you leave the noise behind for a good nightâ€™s rest. We felt very safe in the area and the hotel was close to the river for a walk at the river Thames . The staff was very friendly. The breakfast included was very generous . Staying for 9 nights they moved us to the lower level with the least stairs. Thanks again. There are no lift but the staircase is very comfortable to climb. There were always somebody available to help with directions and they have maps and info available . We felt safe as the front door was kept locked at all times. Thanks again for a lovely stay

Reviews.Title: “Good location but small room”
Reviews.Author: ts6084
Reviews.Content: Located very close to Pimlico tube stop and Victoria station which made travel very easy. Nice area of London for families and couples, pretty quite and nice. Wouldn't be ideal for people looking to stay in a good area to party in. The room was pretty small. Bathroom was tiny and everything was kind of old. Not dirty or non working, just kind of old. Had a room on the top floor and the wifi didn't reach up to that floor. Had to go downstairs to use the internet. No reception desk to be found, didn't need to talk to reception at all during the stay but I wouldn't have been sure how to get a hold of someone from the hotel had I needed to.

Reviews.Title: “Set tone for foul trip to London”
Reviews.Author: mcharper
Reviews.Content: Three months ago, my wife e-mailed back and forth with this hotel, formerly recommended by Rick Steves. After trying to secure with a credit card, she was told (in writing) to just pay upon arrival. We have e-mail confirmation and actually took a printed copy. Walked up to hotel after a long 15 minute walk from Victoria tube station, and were gruffly met by an individual who barked that they had no vacancies. We produced the confirmation and after she "spoke to the manager" about the e-mail confirmation, she said that the manager "thought it was spam" and did not reserve. We were out of luck. No family room, bye-bye. Paid 3x as much for rack rate rooms at two hotels on the same block.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for 5!”
Reviews.Author: ampkmp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blades Hotel last week while stopping over in London on vacation. As we were traveling with 3 young children, we were pleased to find a room to sleep 5 comfortably, and in an excellent location, convenient to Victoria and Pimlico stations and a short walk to Buckingham Palace and Westminster Abbey. The room and bathroom were clean and tidy, and the hotel staff friendly. Continental breakfast provided as well as free wi-fi. We would highly recommend to anyone traveling with a family, and we will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Blades is an Edge Above Others”
Reviews.Author: LazDownUnder
Reviews.Content: While my room was just big enough for a double bed and ensuite, it was more than adequate for my seven night/day stay in London while mixing mostly business with some sightseeing and catching up with a few friends. (Keep in mind that hotel rooms in London tend to be small anyways. What Blades offered is the standard sized room for two in my case.) The location of Blades is great, ie within 5 minute walk of the Pimilico Station on the Victoria Underground Line and just 2 minutes from the #24 bus, not to mention some excellent restaurants and for the fit and water orientated, Queen Mother Sports Centre, which offers a 25 metre pool with clean, clear water. The staff at Blades are friendly, efficient and responsive. They make sure that the hotel is secure through double locking doors which is reduced to one during the daytime. My room was always tidied up and refreshed each day and the buffet breakfast was a pleasant surprise with fresh fruit, all kinds of cereal and muesli, yogurt, hot drinks, juices and a family friend B&B, homey type of setting which is conducive towards meeting some interesting people who are also staying at Blades. If you want to meet others, that's fine. If you want to dine in silence, that is totally acceptable, too. Let me just say that Blades Hotel represents very good value for what you get and what they have to offer. I can highly recommend contacting Claudia or Madi to book your room now before it's fully booked as it was during my stay there in late May.

Reviews.Title: “Despicable - MOLD”
Reviews.Author: bhue
Reviews.Content: Although I am still traveling I wanted to provide anyone who is considering this hotel with a fair warning. I did not receive such and am compelled to make sure that the truth be known. This hotel made the Rick Steve's list and I can not imagine how. It makes me wonder if Rick is being paid by the hotels to make recommendations. We reserved a triple room that literally the beds extended from wall to wall and you had to walk sideways to get to the very small area where you had to pack suitcases on top of one another so they would fit. When we walked in we smelled a peculiar odor and did not immediately identify. Having just flown all night we each wanted a shower and to take a walk through London. The bathroom was so small you could sit on the toilet and reach the shower. The shower kept filling up with water as the drain did not work and we had to lather, turn the water off and wait for it to drain, then rinse, turn the water off, ad infinity... The next day we had no hot water at all!!! I went to speak to the inn keeper and she said that the hot water is cut off at 11am and she would turn on but it takes 2 hrs to heat up. We went without showering. I also informed her at that time that we could not get the shower to drain, she said it was good to know these things and she would call a plumber. I also informed her that we could not use the lamp on the nightsdtand because we realized that the electrical outlet was busted to pieces and was a fire hazard. She tried to give me an extension cord so we could use the single outlet that appeared intact. That evening I went to the small general area in the hotel so I could read while my husband and son watched tv. Not to my surprise the lamps did not work so I had to bring the lamp from my room to the general area so I could read. The final day, we got up early, took showers, and I accidently flooded the bathroom. I thought I had determined how much water I could have floating in the bottom of the shower and still open the door and I misjudged. Some water came out and I had to clean everything up with towels. The inn keeper was very upset with me. Lastly, my son and I are now very sick as we continue our journeys through Europe. We figured out what the smell probably was: MOLD. STAY AWAY!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Service and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JodeCam
Reviews.Content: Our first conversation with Blades Hotel was via email back in Australia and from the first response we knew that we'd be made welcome. We told Kevin we'd be there for one night and he let us know what was close by and what not to miss. Very helpful! The room itself was adequete and clean (but almost in need of a refurbishment). Would only recommened staying in the top floors to those who won't be worried about carting their luggage up the many stairs. We stayed in the top floor and enjoyed being away from the street noise and also had a better viewpoint over the street. Breakfast the next morning was basic but enough to keep you full till lunch, plus it was prepared entirely by Kevin and his staff. All the attention shown by the staff combined with the close proximity to the tube station means we would recommend this to anyone after a budget room that is clean and close to the major attractions (we walked for 10 hours and saw Green Park, Hyde Park, Oxford Street, National Museum, Covent Garden, Buckingham Palace tour, Westminster Abbey, Westminster Cathedral, Houses of Parliament/Big Ben and a London Eye trip. All without stepping onto a bus or taxi! Thanks for the great stay, Cameron and Jodie, Brisbane, Queensland, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: CarolinePenny
Reviews.Content: Easy to find hotel with excellent transport links. A safe neighbourhood, but the hotel itself is quite secure (ring the doorbell to enter unless you have the key, and staff letting you in does expect a reason for your visit first). The staff (mother and daughter?) is friendly and modest, the room had beautiful bedsheets and was clean throughout. Nice and high ceilings as well. Same thing for the bathroom: small, but clean. No bugs, no funny smells, good mattress. A quiet neighbourhood, so potentially a good night sleep but I slept close to the radiator which made funny ticking noises as it heated up and cooled down again. Breakfast was very basic, so don't raise your expectations. Toast and jams, cereals, a can of milk and one of orange juice (not fresh though). No buns or anything. Coffee was lukewarm, unless you go really early in the morning. But again, the service is honest and decent. The lightbulb in my table lamp broke and after reporting it, it was replaced immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Superb central London location and speedy transport links!Great.”
Reviews.Author: natalie064
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in this lovely hotel and I must recognize the value of this place.The excellence of service started with contact by email. Their replies were prompt and accommodating. It is safe, affordable and clean, the staff is very polite and friendly.I had a nice breakfast, plenty of coffee,tee,juices, a nice buffet I cand say. The location it's excellent, fantastic..it's easy to take the bus no 24 and it's only 10 minutes walk from Victoria Staion. There are many restaurants and shops around the area.The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable.The wireless works very well.There is an efficient management and I hope to stay again at Blades next time I ll be in London.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor and inadequate service”
Reviews.Author: Fee L
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was surly and brusque, the "2nd floor room" was up 6 floors(no lift, no help offered), the advertised wi-fi never materialised and there was no soap etc in my room when I arrived. The heating refused to work, despite twiddling with the radiator and when I mentioned some of these concerns at breakfast I was told that I could have come down and asked- 6 floors in my pj s I suppose. Even if I had done this, there is no reception desk, the bell doesn't work and so you have to go outside and ring the door bell...When I fancied a warming drink I discovered that only 1 socket works and the kettle lead isn't long enough to reach so you have to move the chair, move the bed and put the kettle on the floor! There are much better hotels on this road- try them instead!

Reviews.Title: “Good location on a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: OkosPala
Reviews.Content: It is close to the heart of London: Piccadilly Circus and the Buckingham Palace are in walking distance. It's relatively cheap (compared to other London hotels). Staff is very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 40 nights over 5 month period”
Reviews.Author: Scotcav
Reviews.Content: I will have spent 40 nights over a 5 month period in the Blades Hotel. I had tried several other hotels in Pimlico and Vauxhall area before finding, and sticking with Blades. As on business in London, and spending half my time away from home, I need a hotel that is in a great location with easy and quick access to the main Underground lines. I need a clean hotel with fast breakfast service, as normally running late as I canâ€™t get out of bed! Most of the hotels I have stayed in London can provide these, but the where the Blades hotel has differed for me is that it is not, like others, a plastic, lifeless, faceless hotel. There is character to the building which gives a more homely feel. The location is on a quiet (as much as London can be) street, and allows you to get a good night sleep after a long day in the office. Blades provides a clean, quiet, friendly, no hassle week for me. If not on business, and had my family with me, I would also use this hotel. I plan to use this hotel every other week for the foreseeable future.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay in Central London"”
Reviews.Author: TimB187175
Reviews.Content: Thank you once again for such a comfortable stay - very freindly reception and as always very polite and helpful. Claudia was especailly helpful as I had to get back to France quickly because of a family death and she helped me with the boarding pass. KInd regards, Tim

Reviews.Title: “Clean , Comfortable and Safe..”
Reviews.Author: Bobmadrid1
Reviews.Content: I have travelled all over the worls and like many peole am watching my budget , I found Blades Hotel to be a perfect antidote to hectic London Life. The rooms seem to have recently been decorated and carpets replaced.. My room was well appointed and airy comfortable bed and good clean linen.. TV tea and coffe making facilities.. and all in a very central location with great transport links.. I took the 24 bus which stops near by on the recommendation of the charming lady at reception which on took me to Trafalgar Sq passing The Houses of Parliament, Downing St, Westminter Abbey etc I will book again

Reviews.Title: “have been severely bitten by bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: lll01
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay in this hotel because of a friend's recommendation and a great location. When I first came in I was pleasantly surprised by cosy feel and the character it had. It was somewhat spoiled by not a very pleasant customer service I received (I paid and was given the key and then the receptionist disappeared not even telling me where the room was or when the breakfast time was). Further encounter with that lady made me somewhat scared of her. The room itself was not big but had all essentials, I was quite happy with it. However, it all was terribly spoiled when I woke up the next morning to find out that my face, neck and arms were severely bitten by the bed bugs! The bites didn't go away for almost a week, they itched but it wasn't as bad as the psychological trauma I had experienced I haven't told the staff straight away because I was afraid of the hotel lady. Next day though my friend (who had some other problems with the hotel) told the staff about my experience and the bed bugs. Apparently, they apologised and promised to sort out the issue. I don't know whether they have but wouldn't recommend staying there just to be on the safe side.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME STAY”
Reviews.Author: MWALDERHAUG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blades for 3 nights and loved it!!! Claudia who manages the hotel was so friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The location is awesome, we took the TUBE from the airport to the hotel and upon leaving took it also to the Cruise Ship terminal in Tilbury. The hotel was located with in walking distance to Buckingham Palace and Harrods, of course we love to walk! The hotel offered free wi-fi and even had a laptop to use if you did now have one. Will stay at the Blades again on our next trip to London.... we highly recommend it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: erinash10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blades Hotel in October 2010. I had read tripadvisor before I booked the hotel, so I understood the lack of lift to the higher floors and small bathrooms. In London though, what can you expect? It was fine. The hotel is clean and mostly quiet and a great value for what is offered. The location is good, not even a 5 minute walk to the nearest tube station. But if you just walk a bit up the road 15 mins there is the next major tube station, Victoria Station, and Buckingham Palace, the parks, etc. The breakfast is a typical English continental, but kept us happy and full into the afternoon. As for the staff, my experience was that they were friendly. I needed a taxi booked, no prob, I needed something for the room, no prob. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Daniel19777777
Reviews.Content: The locaytion is excellent within walking distance to all major attractions. The staff was very polite an efficient. Very reach breakfast, clean rooms. I would definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Too many steps and no A/C.”
Reviews.Author: LizinCo
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the top floor -- 84 steps up -- and no one was available to help carry our luggage. I actually tore the meniscus in my knee, which later required surgery! The location was very good -- near a major tube station, with shops and restaurants nearby. The hotel was clean but ordinary, the breakfast was simple but decent. I found the proprietor difficult to understand and not very warm or pleasant. (My 20 year old daughter kept saying she was afraid of her!) A relative called the hotel for me and was told I was not staying there. We left for two weeks, then returned for a final night. Before leaving, I made it very clear that we needed a room on a lower floor. Lo and behold, we were booked into the same room. Upon protesting, we were moved and only had to climb about 42 steps. Now, I normally travel with a minimal amount of luggage, but we had more than usual as we were headed to Africa and had camping gear. Will I return? No way.

Reviews.Title: “service has deteriorated”
Reviews.Author: catherine003
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Blades aprox 5 times before whilst Kevin was the manager and been very satisfied. How things have changed, the new manager is not 'customer friendly' and hides behind a lack of english when things need 'sorting out' in respect of the bill and the facilities in the room. What a shame as I don't think it is the sort of service the owner would want for the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Check around for other hotels in the Belgrave Street area”
Reviews.Author: klm10
Reviews.Content: Kevin is gone and the new staff is not guest friendly even when you can find them. We ran out of toilet paper one morning. There was no back up roll and no box of Kleenex tissues. We found the manager down stairs and asked for toilet paper and got a nod. Fifteen minutes later when there was no manager and no toilet paper we went back down stairs again. We were told by the breakfast person the manager was gone and would not be back for two hours. I had to use a leftover napkin for the job. This was absolutely unacceptable! One of the days our room was not made up. There were no hooks in the bathroom to hang our towels and we had to use dirty towels one day. I finally had to ask for clean towels. The breakfast was the least of the five places we stayed on our trip. There was no fresh fruit and only two types of fruit from a can or jar. There were no eggs or breakfast meats. All the other places we stayed had a full breakfast menu, three or more fresh fruits and fresh breads or croissants. The wifi did not work. We tried to check out at 7AM and have a taxi called. I buzzed the manager twice with no answer, so we just left. All the other accommodations we stayed at had extremely friendly and helpful staff that were always around and attentive. There were several other hotels in the area that I would check out if we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Hostile service. Choose another hotel on Belgrave Road.”
Reviews.Author: DCtrav4
Reviews.Content: The woman in charge makes you feel as though you have done something wrong by merely showing up. Heaven forbid you ask a question. Worse, for those willing to figure it our for themselves, there is no wi-fi available in rooms (though promised) and no access from lobby. We requested her assistance in determining location and calling a cab for our theater evening. She barely glanced at the tickets, said she couldn't help and suggested we hail a cab on the street. We ended up at the wrong theater -- the Old Vic, instead of at the West End across the river. Fortunately, the folks at the box office re-directed us. That cost us another cab ride and a delayed seating. Lack of wi-fi made booking dinner reservations difficult and meant we were unable to check and re-confirm our flight to Amsterdam, so we spent 4 precious vacation hours in an airport unnecessarily. Neither our soap nor our towels were refreshed after 3 days. We had to ask for clean towels. We bought our own soap at Boots. The room was smallish but to be expected in London, and we knew in advance there was no AC; however, the lack of a fan to provide a bit of breeze is almost unconscionable. The location on Belgrave Road is terrific. Luckily, there are many other hotels and B&Bs just steps away that you can choose. Best: Location Worst: Hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Autumnsky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly adequate if you do your homework and know what to expect. Yes, there are stairs. Somehow I knew that before I got there, so I do not know if it was stated on the website or the confirmation email. Yes, the rooms are small. Pack light. This is re-purposed home in a residential area. It is not an 'American-style' hotel, but when traveling in another country why would one assume and expect that everything is the same? We stayed in the Quad, and one nice feature was the separate twin beds for the children. Yes, the bathroom does need work, and again, it is small. In any case, we enjoyed our stay and the breakfast each morning added to the experience. Kevin had good advice for us and my children found him very interesting. When we arrived he asked my 10-year old if she knew how her state (Maryland) got its name, and he was very surprised that she did know (Queen Mary, NOT the Virgin Mary as he claims some people answer). I was nervous about having children in this hotel since it was clear from the room types listed that most people would be singles or couples. But really, it was completely fine (but I don't let them run around like hooligans and make noise) and we felt comfortable. We loved the neighborhood and really enjoyed the restaurants in the area (St. George's Pub, Pimlico Tandori). There were little stores nearby for picking up items like shampoo or beverages. The Pimlico laundry service is a good deal, drop off your clothes and get them after a day of sightseeing. Getting around London is a snap and we had a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, delightful, helpful manager, Kevin.”
Reviews.Author: Kathleenonthego
Reviews.Content: Rooms were cramped, but if you know that ahead of time, it's acceptable. Breakfast had variety, with cereals, breads, lunch meats & cheeses, yogurt, juices, fruit, and of course tea. We arrived late, and the night person was asleep. We had to find an open hotel down the street and have them call them, despite their advertising that there was 24 hr. service. Then they put us in a room without an ensuite bathroom and we had to go down the hall to use the facilities. The moved us to the room we had paid for the next day. Other than that, It was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: webdiva3
Reviews.Content: Well located on Belgrave Road, very close to Pimpico tube stop. We walked nearly everywhere. Kevin deserves the accolades he gets on these reviews; he's very funny, helpful and so knowledgeable about London. He makes breakfast an event! We were there with cousins and we really enjoyed the solarium. There are dozens of restaurants very close by. Ask Kevin for recommendations, and avoid O Solo Mio (rude). This is a good value hotel; not luxurious, but adequate for a short visit to the city. Bed linens are nice. They are upgrading the hall & stair rugs and the hotel in general. It's a safe, good area of London and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: jeni4
Reviews.Content: Good base for exploring London - very close to train station and bus stop. It was my first time in London and Kevin (who was the only staff member we met I think) was friendly and helpful in showing us where to go and how to get there. The building is a bit old and worn but our room was clean and had everything we needed. We did have possibly the smallest room (but they told us this) - the double bed was right up against the window with an ensuite added in - but we didn't mind. There was a bit of traffic noise at night time - but we discovered ear plugs are great when you are travelling - make sure you take them!! Breakfast was fairly simple but good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal budget family base”
Reviews.Author: jtcosta
Reviews.Content: If you're planning a short stay in London and want a reasonanbly priced base near the centre this can be a good choice. Ours was a 5-sleeper room on the ground floor, adequate for its purpose. The choice of foods at breakfast was what we expected, always fresh and constantly supervised by the staff. London's major attractions are easily accessible via bus or nearby tube. There is a choice of corner shops, supermarkets, street stalls and restaurants in the surrounding streets. We'd especially like to thank Kevin for his helpfulness at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MCPNottingham
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location - between Victoria and Pimlico tube stops. That's where the good news ends. We stayed for 2 nights in the smallest room imaginable. There was a coat rail to hang clothes on (rather than a wardrobe) in an already cramped space. The shower room was a studded wall squeezed into the same space. There were no shelves to put tolietries on and I'd defy the slimest super model to be able to turn around without knocking something over! Our room was on the ground floor and we were convinced the national door slamming/bell ringing championships were taking place in that hotel on the weekend we stayed there. Unbelievably noisy first thing. There was no actual reception desk - you had to hunt people out to get service. Breakfast was a DIY affair - little boxes of cereal, 2 toasters, some bread and jam. An old bloke in a blazor wanders around the breakfast room making what he seems to think are hilarious jokes about the various nationalities in the room. Presumably this is to detract from the poor quality breakfast and stewed tea. He pointed at us and said "These are the real foreigners in this hotel. They're English. We never get English people in here. What the bloody hell are you doing here?" I was wandering that myself. Avoid this hotel. It's expensive, noisy, badly maintained, the service is poor and the bloke in the breakfast room is the only one who thinks he is amusing.

Reviews.Title: “Vile Place - DON'T STAY !”
Reviews.Author: Hakunmatata37
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a room for 2 nights and as soon as we walked in we knew we had done the wrong thing. It is a tired property with old decor and walls and doors in poor condition. When you walked in the 'musty' stale smell hit your nostrils. We were shown to a 'reception room' which was quite dirty to check in. You just felt unclean being there !!!!! It was in no way a 3 star hotel. We asked to see our room and this was horrible. I won;t go into details but I wouldn't even ask homeless people to stay there. We asked for our deposit back and were told no. We spoke to the manager by phone as he was out. He was VERY VERY rude. Luckily we found a much better hotel opposite which was cheaper and our credit card company has refunded our Â£85 after seeing the photo's we took as they agreed it wasn't 'as described'.

Reviews.Title: “Numerous stairs awful even after being guaranteed a lower floor room”
Reviews.Author: FunTraveler25
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed Kevin and his interesting take on the local scene. He was a gracious host. The breakfast selection was fine and the food was nicely presented. We had requested a room on the lower floors because my wife had just gone through a complete knee replacement. Unfortunately that did not work out. And on our return trip late in our trip we were relegated to an even higher floor after making a request for the lowest floor. We did have very noisy neighbors on our first visit and had to beat on the wall at 3 am for them to get quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: NH_Princess
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 23 year old daughter stayed here for 3 nights in Room #8 with one double bed and one twin and private bath. While the room and bath were small, it was very clean and comfortable. The shower was tiny, but the hot water and good pressure made up for it. The innkeeper Kevin was a great guy. He found us a taxi to Heathrow for almost the same amount as the Heathrow Express. Breakfast was included and provided a good start to the day. The area seemed relatively safe and was within easy walking distance to the Pimlico and Victoria stations. We actually walked from Vauxhall with luggage without difficulty. (P.S. I got a better rate by writing to Kevin directly rather than going through any of the websites online.)

Reviews.Title: “Same postcode as the Queen!”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelxxx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its location. A previous review rated the location as 'poor' - so the Queen live in a poor location as she shares same postcode? Really silly question. Very clean hotel, not 5 star but that reflects in room rates. Great buffet breakfast and very good staff who make the stay very pleasant. Advice on events and hotels from a guy who seems to run the place. No lifts so ask for a lower floor if a problem -i t is a period building. The best bed and breakfast hotel we have stayed in a capital city. Local transport - BRILLIANT!

Reviews.Title: “Refurbishment Required-Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: Figaro_7
Reviews.Content: The external appearance is fine-once you are inside it all goes wrong. The overall decor is poor and our tiny room located 4 flights up was very poor.Holes in the wall,holes in the curtain,holes in the towels.The lock on our bedroom door required much attention to make it work,it looked as if it had been broken into and then badly repaired.The shower was pathetic.On the positive side the sheets were clean and the bed was reasonably comfortable but not good enough to change our overall view -would we return-NO WAY

Reviews.Title: “A friedly gem”
Reviews.Author: JoannaMouse
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Blades several times, and enjoy returning there. Kevin's friendly attention in the (non-cooked but excellent) breakfast room is a highlight. Drawbacks are the steep stairs - especially on the top floor, and the occasional need to seek help with the shower taps, but everything is there - if one asks! Very convenient for bus and tube.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Blades Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LynsterHfx
Reviews.Content: We like to stay in this location when we go to London and this year left booking til very late but were lucky to get into this hotel. Keven and the staff made the stay very enjoyable indeed. We were lucky <haha> to get one of the top floor rooms and as Kevin said by the time we reached the top with our luggage we would have "faith". For those who cannot do steps it is something to consider when booking. For us it simply gave us some more exercise. The rooms are VERY clean and have everything you need. Everything was in good working order. There is a lovely place on the 3rd level I believe for you to sit in an open concept room and enjoy the day or evening. We would definetly book at the Blades Hotel now instead of the other hotel where we usually stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, personal service”
Reviews.Author: TXRobin
Reviews.Content: Spent five wonderful nights at the Blades with my husband and two teens. Room was small but adequate - typical of European hotels. Kevin was great and the personal touch by him and his staff was terrific. Breakfast was great and includes cheese and meat but nothing hot. The only thing I would change is to provide some variety in the breakfast buffet for those of use who spent more than 2 or 3 days in the hotel. Wifi was available but didn't always work very well. Would definitely stay at the Blades again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Will return!”
Reviews.Author: travelmavenCA
Reviews.Content: Kevin and his staff were welcoming and friendly. Upper floor rooms were very quiet, even with windows open all night. Breakfast was a friendly affair with other travelers exchanging ideas. The teen shoppers were thrilled with Kevin's suggestions. More like a B&B than cookie cutter hotel, and perfect for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ClaireBearJackson
Reviews.Content: I would reccomend the hotel it's great if your staying in London for a few days. I stayed with a group of friends it was all our first time in London and the tube stike was on when we were their but we still found it really easy to get around and the hotel was pretty central. The room was cosy but it was clean,would have been better if the towles were replaced daily but overall I was pleased with the room. The staff were lovely and very helpfull I would use the hotel again next time I'm in London.

Reviews.Title: “A good location for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: CornwallMole
Reviews.Content: Some disappointment with this hotel, which although very well sited for a city break to London, was more of a B&B, than a hotel. The room was clean and of an adequate size. Tea & coffee facilities were available but had to be picked up from a cupboard. Nowhere to safely plug in kettle. A change of towels was only "permitted" every three days! Despite our leaving very damp towels out in the bathroom after the second day, on returning to our room the next afternoon and finding the same damp towels hung again on the non heated towel rail!! The breakfast although continental, was limited. Very close to Pimlico underground. No lift so beware of the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “The Blades Hotel is brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: AzProf
Reviews.Content: On our first morning in London, Kevin, the wonderfully witty manager of the Blades Hotel, marched our group of four plus several of his other guests off past Buckingham Palace for "something we must see". It was only a short walk (the hotel is wonderfully located) and Kevin kept us entertained the whole way. We stopped just down from the palace at the edge of a small group of people. Minutes later, cars started arriving carrying various members of the Royal Family. In short order, THE ENTIRE ROYAL FAMILY (the Queen, Prince Charles, Princes William, Edward and Harry, etc., etc. etc.) showed up to unveil a statue of the Queen Mother. Had any other hotel manager taken the time to walk his guests to this once-in-a-lifetime event? Absolutely not and that's why Kevin and The Blades Hotel in London gets our highest possible recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: catherine003
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have now enjoyed two weekends in London and have used Blades Hotel on each occasion. The hotel is in an excellent location being vey good for transport links to all the tourist attractions/sights. The rooms are clean and the staff are very helpful. Breakfast is provided and very good with a selection of fruit, cereal, choice of breads, cold meat and cheese. The addition of crumpets is a nice touch. We were very well looked after both times and would not hesitate to recommend others to try the hospitality extended to guests at Blades

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RussNC
Reviews.Content: Traveling with 3 young children to London can be a daunting task. It's great to know that when you arrive at the Blades Hotel you've found a comfortable home for the week. The Blades has one of London's few family rooms that actually will accommodate a family of 5. You trade off a hallway bathroom (private to the room), but it's more than made up for by the clean and comfortable room that fits a family and all your belongings. The convenience of being 3 minutes from the blue line on the tube and half-a block from the bus stop is tremendous. All of this is topped off by the friendly staff. Our youngest child considered the manager, Kevin - who welcomes you to breakfast each morning, one of the highlights of her trip. Breakfast is served in an intimate dining room, with a nice selection of choices. The guests were from all over Europe which makes for an educational and very international experience. The staff was very kind to the children, helpful for touring tips and went out of their way to help with my internet needs. They even decorated with red/white/blue balloons and signs for the presidential inauguration. I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and agree with the many positive postings that led us to book here. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: MariBooks
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to London for the World Travel Market Show and my husband wanted to tag along. Since he and my 5-year-old daughter hadn't seen London, I brought them along so they could sightsee while I worked. The Blades Hotel met all our needs. Very close to the Victoria Tube station, which is a hub for many lines, the Blades is a great neighborhood in Kensington--close to restaurants, transport and shopping. The staff is all lovely: very friendly and accommodating. Kevin, the proprietor, takes good care to help you make the most of your trip. For example, my husband was going to take my daughter up to see the changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace. Kevin suggested that she might be more interested in seeing the changing of the Horse Guard, which is just as beautiful, but with better access and a clearer vantage point for a small child. He was right. As for the accommodations, the rooms are clean and well appointed. Breakfasts are simple but quality. We will definitely stay here again (Note: While this hotel is highly recommended, note that it is "low frills". So if you're looking for a chocolate on your pillow, stay elsewhere. But if you want a well-located, clean, friendly and comfortable (and well-priced) hotel, the Blades is your place.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spotless, great staff”
Reviews.Author: mellon5
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a room for 4 nights. There were 3 of us for 1 night and 2 for the other three and we were able to stay in the triple for the price of the double which was great so we didn't have to pack up and move. The bedroom and bathroom were spotless, beds comfortable, view was nice. Breakfast was good with excellent service and converstion from Kevin. Lydia was helpful and sweet during checkin. Location is wonderful, easy walk from Victoria Station and Pimlico Underground. Bus 24 , which runs up through Trafalgar square, stopped half a block away and the area seemed safe at night. Local restaurants including a Pizza Express and a Tapas bar were really tasty. Thanks for a great stay! We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, Loved Kevin”
Reviews.Author: SharonUt
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Blades after recommendation from this site and others. We had the family room on the main floor and it was perfect for us. The hotel appeared clean and breakfast was great. We mentioned to Kevin that we were going to Paris on the Eurostar the next morning and he offered to hale a cab for us. He told us to come to breakfast at 6:30 and we would need to take a cab at about 7:15 to make our train. Breakfast is not usually served until 7:00, but he said just come down early. He was reallly great, we really enjoyed our stay there at Blades hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: soplayalready
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to London for the first time and was looking for a place that was reasonable and close to the tourist attractions. The Blades Hotel was just what the doctor ordered; not only was the staff great but the other guests were friendly and it was more of a family atmosphere than a hotel atmosphere. We stayed eight days with no regrets. Kevin and Lydia were the perfect hosts and we were treated as family. This is a Victorian Hotel that is not ultra modern or ultra swank but if you are looking for a nice, clean and safe place to stay this is the place for you. Our intention was not to spend much time in our room and we did not. Public transporation is just a short walk away both the bus and underground. Musems, the Palace and other London Landmarks are within walking distance. I was not disappointed because I did take into account all the reviews on this site. For us there were no surprises. I am planning to return to London in the not too distant future and I will not hesitate to stay at the Blades again.

Reviews.Title: “A little shabby but did the job!”
Reviews.Author: caroleandpaul
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Blades for a weekend and on first impressions thought the hotel was adequate. We had the last room available which was a single room with a double bed and there was enough room for both of us. The room was clean but it really smelt of Garlic! The smell was so strong we kept the window open day and night! The bed was lumpy and could of done with renewing. The room did not have a hairdryer and tea and coffee facilities as advertised and therefore didn't take a hairdryer with me so that was a bit inconvenient! The bathroom was ok with a good power shower which was welcome after a long day in the big smoke! The breakfast was basic but there was plenty of it and set us up for the day. The staff were friendly and helpful, the manager was always up for a laugh and making jokes, very amusing! So basically it catered for our needs as all we wanted was somewhere to sleep at the end of the night. If you want luxury then probably not ideal but otherwise a good base for sightseeing and very reasonsible in price.

Reviews.Title: “Overall not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Starr23
Reviews.Content: Last June I made my 4th trip to London. I had always stayed in the Sussex Gardens area and I had spent the first 3 nights of this trip in Sussex Gardens before going to Normandy and Paris. I returned to London from Paris and decided to spend my last 2 nights at the Blades Hotel, based on glowing reviews on this and other travel sights. I was disappointed with my room at the Blades. It was at the very top of the building at the end of a long climb of stairs. The room was shabby and in need of a good cleaning. It was very stuffy and the small fan provided served only to blow the dust bunnies around. There was no screen in the window and opening the window was an invitation for the flies to occupy the room. Getting some sleep was not easy. On the positive side I did enjoy the breakfast room and the selection of food available. The only staff I encountered were two very young girls, who were very polite and helpful. I am returning to London this September and I will be going back to the Sussex Gardens area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: lh9789
Reviews.Content: Blades Hotel makes up for the tiny bathroom with the hospitality of it's staff and the very comfortable beds. In fact, I was told I was only the second person to sleep on the beds in our room, so they are quite new. Most beds on our 7-country trip were hard, but not these, they were comfortably soft, so it was the best sleep I got on my entire trip! I also enjoyed the breakfast and opportunity to ask touristy questions, plus looking around teh sunroom. The staff bend over backwards to help--especially the feather-light lady who carried our very heavy luggage up the stairs (!) , handed us an informational sheet all about the neighborhood, set us up with a pot of tea for our room, and told us where we could grab a bite to eat. The room is done up nicely for a budget hotel and has a traditional English feel with the chinz drapes. Another reviewer mentioned the lack of closet, but the closet rod is in a open area like the bay of a bay window. I thought the open space made the small room feel bigger, and I liked the tin ceiling. I truly feel that, other than gaining more space, the hotel is at its best.

Reviews.Title: “The Blades is the "Cutting Edge"”
Reviews.Author: haygirl16
Reviews.Content: Cute, little hotel. Wonderful staff. Located close to an underground station. Good breakfast each morning. We had the 2nd floor balcony just above the Blades sign. It was a good sized room and suited our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and more”
Reviews.Author: IrishroverBelfast
Reviews.Content: We were recommended by friends in Orlando who stayed before to go to the Blades Hotel. It lacks elevators and some other modernisation as it a late Victorian house converted to a hotel but it is a really clean and friendly with a brilliant location. While were there there was the royal State Opening of Parliament and the hotel manager, Kevin, took all the guests to a great spot on the route of the Queen's procession to Westminster - a sensational day. Our room was a moderate size and the breakfast was a time to plan the day with advice been given on theatres and places to visit. Certainly will stay there again and recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as wrote in the reviews”
Reviews.Author: sweet-melancholy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Blades for 3 nights and there were bed bugs. Although the manager moved us to another room for the last night, he didn't apologize for the problem and kept saying that they never had the problem before and suggest we probably got beaten somewhere. The sheets and towels were not changed everyday but every 3 days. So if you stay there for 3 nights, you'll just get fresh towels on the first day. The breakfast was ok but pretty basic. As the reviews said, the manager entertain the guests every morning during breakfaster; it was nice, but we don't pay 100 just for jokes. The hotel is at a decent location, which is very near to the Pimlico station on the Victoria line. There are plenty of B & Bs on the same road so keep your choice open.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, â€œDoes What It Says on the Tinâ€�”
Reviews.Author: BridgwaterMonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed the second weekend in March 07 for 2 nights. The Hotel is literally 3 minutes walk from â€˜Pimlicoâ€™ Underground station, which gives quick access to the centre of London, Victoria Railway station is one stop up the line! We received a warm welcome from the Staff, who where friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The rooms were very clean along with the bedding and the En-suite Showeroom. The room we had (1st floor) was a good size in relation to the price paid, it gave you enough room to move about without falling over each other. The En-suite Showeroom was all you needed and worked for us, however was very small and could be a challenge for above average to large sized people! The Breakfast was good with a selection of different cereals, breads cold meats and cheese etc. The only thing we felt missing that we like to see in a continental breakfast would be some croissants / fresh pastries, otherwise it was good! In relation to the prices of other hotels we looked at in London this hotel was good value for money, clean, with good transport links to the rest of the city, we would happily stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: RRRinMemphis
Reviews.Content: We received a warm and helpful reception from the manager. The room was small and the bath even smaller but sufficient for our needs. The Underground was only 2 blocks away and the 24 Bus was just out the front door. Wonderful coffeeshop around the corner along with a friendly Spanish restaurant and nifty pizza place. All in all a good value in incredibly expensive London.

Reviews.Title: “Typical European Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shareen3
Reviews.Content: We loved the manager (he entertained us at breakfast every day, which was basic fare, but decent and free). But, one woman in particular was not very pleasant. There is no lift in the hotel and there are 5 "stories" - so beware. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are very small, but like the manager said - this is Europe. If you want large accomodations then stay in America. Overall extremely average, but with the incredible prices in London, not unbearable.
